ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Here i go again :-P
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah. I sometimes keep items around to give to newbies later. Even when my druid was only lvl 10 I would turn in CB belts and come back with armor to give to
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah. I sometimes keep items around to give to newbies later. Even when my
druid was only lvl 10 I would turn in CB belts and come back with armor to
give to low lvls.
It's actually part of my guild practice to help others. The Spellbinders
pride ourselves on being kind to others. The other day a guy was stuck in a
pit in West Freeport. he was diseased and couldn't move around without
getting killed from the disease/dot. He didnt know how to get out and had
less than 40hp left. So I called a wizard guildmate to TL him to his bind
point. I waited at his bind point to heal and cure him. It felt good to help
someone. :-)
luv,
-Su

> This is exactly what happened to me. i had asked if
> anyone could help a young druid stand a fighting
> chance on her own...i was meaning just buffs...along
> came this WONDERFUL person who suited me with some
> basic leather armor and gave me 50pp to boot to help
> buy my spells...i was amazed!!! He said he was
> fulfilling a promise...i will be glad to one day have
> the opportunity to give back to another who is just
> starting out...What is it they say..."Pay It
> Forward"??
>
> **hugs**
> Amaiya, Fennin Ro Druid, Loyal to Tunare
>
> --- Su <suceress@...> wrote:
> > Heh. Yeah. I've found that being friendly with
> > people is profitable. I don't
> > do it for money, I like to be nice and joke with
> > people. The other day some
> > guy gave me 100pp just for emoting something.
> > And high lvl druids have been nice to my druid. One
> > walked up and gave her a
> > bunch of armor, a Forest Loop, and a wraithbone
> > hammer!
> > Very sweet of him.
> > luv,
> > -Su
>
>
